◆ Update()

void Obj::CVehicleComponent::Update ( )
virtual

Замещает Obj::CBaseComponent.

См. определение в файле vehiclecomponent.cpp строка 621

622 {
623  m_reset_this_frame = false;
624 
625  if (!m_update_suspension_only)
626  {
627  get_input();
628  }
629  else
630  {
631  zero_input();
632  }
633 
634  if (m_state == ASLEEP)
635  {
636  // reduced work set if we're asleep
637  GetObject()->SetDisplayMatrix(GetObject()->GetMatrix());
638  update_steering_angles();
639  if (m_controls.brake)
640  {
641  for (int n = m_num_wheels; n--; )
642  {
643  mp_wheels[n].rotvel = 0.0f;
644  }
645  }
646  update_wheel_dynamic_state();
647  update_skeleton();
648  draw_shadow();
649  control_skater();
650  return;
651  }
652 
653  int num_time_steps;
654  float frame_length = Tmr::FrameLength();
655 
656  if (in_artificial_collision())
657  {
658  m_artificial_collision_timer -= frame_length;
659  }
660 
661  // count down timers
662  if (m_gravity_override_timer != 0.0f)
663  {
664  m_gravity_override_timer -= frame_length;
665  if (m_gravity_override_timer <= 0.0f || m_num_wheels_in_contact > 1)
666  {
667  MESSAGE("Ending vehicle gravity override");
668  m_gravity_override_timer = 0.0f;
669  m_gravity_override_fraction = 1.0f;
670  }
671  }
672 
673  // the physics is unstable at low frame rates, so we take multiple physics steps during long frame; if vehicle physics is a significant fraction
674  // of CPU time, this could exacerbate whatever frame rate problems are occuring
675  if (frame_length >= (1.0f / 30.0f))
676  {
677  num_time_steps = static_cast< int >(ceilf(frame_length / (1.0f / 60.0f)));
678  if (num_time_steps > 6)
679  {
680  num_time_steps = 6;
681  }
682  m_time_step = frame_length / num_time_steps;
683  Dbg_Message("CVehicleComponent::Update: using %i steps this frame", num_time_steps);
684  }
685  else
686  {
687  num_time_steps = 1;
688  m_time_step = frame_length;
689  }
690 
691  for (int step = num_time_steps; step--; )
692  {
693  update_dynamic_state();
694 
695  m_force.Set(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
696  m_torque.Set(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
697  for (int n = m_num_wheels; n--; )
698  {
699  mp_wheels[n].rotacc = 0.0f;
700  }
701 
702  if (!m_update_suspension_only)
703  {
704  apply_environment_collisions();
705  if (reset_this_frame()) return;
706  }
707 
708  // teleport wheels to the ground, if within reach of the suspension
709  update_wheel_heights();
710  if (reset_this_frame()) return;
711 
712  // update the steering wheels' angles
713  update_steering_angles();
714 
715  // damp out rotations to create a more drivable car
716  damp_rotation();
717 
718  // accumulate all forces and torques on the body and wheels
719  accumulate_forces();
720 
722  // update state observers
723 
724  if (m_num_wheels_in_contact > 0)
725  {
726  m_air_time = 0.0f;
727  }
728  else
729  {
730  m_air_time += m_time_step;
731  }
732 
733  if (m_num_wheels_in_contact > 0 || m_max_normal_collision_impulse > 0.0f)
734  {
735  m_air_time_no_collision = 0.0f;
736  }
737  else
738  {
739  m_air_time_no_collision += m_time_step;
740  }
741  }
742 
743  if (m_update_suspension_only) return;
744 
745  // draw debug lines
746  draw_debug_rendering();
747 
748  // update object's position and orientation
749  GetObject()->SetPos(m_pos);
750  GetObject()->SetVel(m_vel);
751  GetObject()->SetMatrix(m_orientation_matrix);
752  GetObject()->SetDisplayMatrix(GetObject()->GetMatrix());
753 
754  consider_sleeping();
755 
756  update_skeleton();
757 
758  // Hack to draw shadow
759  draw_shadow();
760 
761  #if 0
762  Mth::Vector forward(0.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
763  forward = m_orientation_matrix.Rotate(forward);
764  float vel = IPS_TO_MPH(Mth::Abs(Mth::DotProduct(m_vel, forward)));
765  PERIODIC(60) DUMPF(vel);
766  #endif
767 
768  // HACK: get player proximity checks, triggers, driving animations, and the like working
769  control_skater();
770 }

void Obj::CVehicleComponent::InitFromStructure ( Script::CStruct *  pParams)
virtual

Замещает Obj::CBaseComponent.

См. определение в файле vehiclecomponent.cpp строка 140

141 {
142  // extract constant parameters from struct; parameters not included in the script are left unchanged
143 
144  // toggles through the debug line drawing states
145  if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x935ab858, "debug")))
146  {
147  m_draw_debug_lines = ++m_draw_debug_lines % 3;
148  }
149  else if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xe6b5fcd9, "full_debug")))
150  {
151  m_draw_debug_lines = (m_draw_debug_lines + 2) % 3;
152  }
153  else if (pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x751da48b, "no_debug")))
154  {
155  m_draw_debug_lines = 0;
156  }
157 
158  // center of mass location (in)
159  // the point around which the car rotates; a lower center of mass reduces roll tendency; the XZ location affects the
160  // vehicle's behavior during jumps
161  if (pParams->ContainsComponentNamed(CRCD(0x93346b8c, "suspension_center_of_mass")))
162  {
163  float suspension_center_of_mass_offset;
164  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x93346b8c, "suspension_center_of_mass"), &suspension_center_of_mass_offset);
165  m_suspension_center_of_mass.Set(0.0f, suspension_center_of_mass_offset, 0.0f);
166  }
167 
168  // mass (lbs)
169  // affects acceleration, suspension behavior, and resistance to drag
170  if (pParams->ContainsComponentNamed(CRCD(0x93fca499, "mass")))
171  {
172  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x93fca499, "mass"), &m_inv_mass);
173  m_inv_mass = vVP_GRAVITATIONAL_ACCELERATION / m_inv_mass;
174  }
175 
176  // moment of inertia (in^2 lbs)
177  // resistance to changes in rotation along the three axes; natural value is about the weight of the car times the
178  // square of the average radius of the car along the axes in question
179  // X: resistance to rolling
180  // Y: resistance to turning
181  // Z: resistance to pitcing during acceleration, braking, and jumps
182  if (pParams->ContainsComponentNamed(CRCD(0x8c6473ec, "moment_of_inertia")))
183  {
184  pParams->GetVector(CRCD(0x8c6473ec, "moment_of_inertia"), &m_inv_moment_body);
185  m_inv_moment_body[X] = vVP_GRAVITATIONAL_ACCELERATION / m_inv_moment_body[X];
186  m_inv_moment_body[Y] = vVP_GRAVITATIONAL_ACCELERATION / m_inv_moment_body[Y];
187  m_inv_moment_body[Z] = vVP_GRAVITATIONAL_ACCELERATION / m_inv_moment_body[Z];
188  }
189 
190  // vehicle body's coefficient of restitution
191  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x79c3b862, "body_restitution"), &m_body_restitution);
192 
193  // vehicle body's coefficient of friction
194  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0xf476273c, "body_friction"), &m_body_friction);
195 
196  // vehicle body's coefficient of friction
197  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x4a23a53c, "body_wipeout_friction"), &m_body_wipeout_friction);
198 
199  // vehicle body's penalty-method interpenetration-prevention spring constant
200  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x1dd4890, "body_spring"), &m_body_spring);
201 
202  // factor of normal impulse over which you can control via steering
203  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0xb9f026ed, "collision_control"), &m_collision_control);
204 
205  // horizontal velocity cutoff below which no in-air slerping to face velocity occurs
206  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x8c14709e, "in_air_slerp_velocity_cutoff"), &m_in_air_slerp_vel_cutoff);
207 
208  // time over which in-air slerping lerps to full strength after takeoff
209  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x2c91e49b, "in_air_slerp_time_delay"), &m_in_air_slerp_time_delay);
210 
211  // in-air slerping strength
212  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x280f0e0b, "in_air_slerp_strength"), &m_in_air_slerp_strength);
213 
214  // special slerping below standard velocity threshold
215  m_vert_correction = pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0x5341806a, "vert_correction"));
216 
217  // maximum steering angle (degrees)
218  if (pParams->ContainsComponentNamed(CRCD(0xc1e5abdd, "max_steering_angle")))
219  {
220  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0xc1e5abdd, "max_steering_angle"), &m_max_steering_angle);
221  m_max_steering_angle = DEGREES_TO_RADIANS(m_max_steering_angle);
222  }
223 
224  // rotational damping parameters which prevent fishtailing and drift
225  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x386837db, "constant_rotational_damping"), &m_const_rotvel_damping);
226  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x469cf79a, "quadratic_rotational_damping"), &m_quad_rotvel_damping);
227 
228  // if the car can be exited via triangle
229  m_exitable = pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xc2a136cc, "exitable"));
230 
231  // if the car has a handbrke
232  m_no_handbrake = pParams->ContainsFlag(CRCD(0xad6c0a46, "no_handbrake"));
233 
234  // the vehicle's body's interaction with the environment is expressed as an array of rectangular colliders
235  if (pParams->ContainsComponentNamed(CRCD(0xfc8c4ac6, "colliders")))
236  {
237  Script::CArray* p_colliders_array;
238  pParams->GetArray(CRCD(0xfc8c4ac6, "colliders"), &p_colliders_array, Script::ASSERT);
239 
240  float average_distance = 0.0f;
241 
242  int num_colliders = p_colliders_array->GetSize();
243  // Dbg_MsgAssert(num_colliders == vVP_NUM_COLLIDERS, ("Number of colliders for CVehicleComponent is incorrect"));
244 
245  for (int collider_idx = num_colliders; collider_idx--; )
246  {
247  SCollider& collider = mp_colliders[collider_idx];
248 
249  Script::CArray* p_corner_array = p_colliders_array->GetArray(collider_idx);
250  Dbg_MsgAssert(p_corner_array->GetSize() == 3, ("Incorrect number of corner vectors in collider array"));
251 
252  Script::CVector* p_corner_vector;
253  p_corner_vector = p_corner_array->GetVector(0);
254  collider.body.m_corner[X] = p_corner_vector->mX;
255  collider.body.m_corner[Y] = p_corner_vector->mY;
256  collider.body.m_corner[Z] = p_corner_vector->mZ;
257  p_corner_vector = p_corner_array->GetVector(1);
258  collider.body.m_first_edge[X] = p_corner_vector->mX;
259  collider.body.m_first_edge[Y] = p_corner_vector->mY;
260  collider.body.m_first_edge[Z] = p_corner_vector->mZ;
261  collider.body.m_first_edge -= collider.body.m_corner;
262  p_corner_vector = p_corner_array->GetVector(2);
263  collider.body.m_second_edge[X] = p_corner_vector->mX;
264  collider.body.m_second_edge[Y] = p_corner_vector->mY;
265  collider.body.m_second_edge[Z] = p_corner_vector->mZ;
266  collider.body.m_second_edge -= collider.body.m_corner;
267

269  average_distance += collider.body.m_corner.Length();
270  average_distance += (collider.body.m_corner + collider.body.m_first_edge).Length();
271  average_distance += (collider.body.m_corner + collider.body.m_second_edge).Length();
272

275  collider.second_edge_length = collider.body.m_second_edge.Length();
276

278  Dbg_MsgAssert(collider.second_edge_length > 0.0f, ("Collider of zero area"));
279  }

860  GetObject()->SetPos(m_pos);
861

863  m_orientation_matrix[Y] = cam_mat[Y];
864  m_orientation_matrix[Z] = -cam_mat[Z];

866  m_orientation.Normalize();
867  m_orientation.GetMatrix(m_orientation_matrix);
868  m_orientation_matrix[W].Set();

870

872  }
873  break;
874  }
875 
876  // @script | Vehicle_AdjustGravity | adjusts effective gravity for a given duration or until the vehicle has two or more wheels on the ground,
877  // whichever occurs first
878  // @parm float | Percent | Percent of standard gravity.
879  // @parm float | Duration | Duration in seconds over which to override gravity.
880  case CRCC(0xdb35aad8, "Vehicle_AdjustGravity"):
881  pParams->GetFloat(CRCD(0x9e497fc6, "Percent"), &m_gravity_override_fraction, Script::ASSERT);
882  m_gravity_override_fraction *= 1.0f / 100.0f;

884  Dbg_MsgAssert(m_gravity_override_timer > 0.0f, ("Vehicle_AdjustGravity must have positive Duration"));
885  MESSAGE("Initiating vehicle gravity override");
886  break;
887

890  // m_force_brake = true;
891  // break;

895  return m_force_brake ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
896 
897  // @script | Vehicle_AllWheelsAreInContact | returns true if all of the wheels are in contact with geo
898  case CRCC(0x279602ed, "Vehicle_AllWheelsAreInContact"):
899  return m_num_wheels_in_contact == m_num_wheels ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
900 
901  // @script | Vehicle_LostCollision | lost a net collision; respond appropriately
902  case CRCC(0x4c73526b, "Vehicle_LostCollision"):
903  {
904  Mth::Vector offset;
905  pParams->GetVector(CRCD(0xa6f5352f, "Offset"), &offset, Script::ASSERT);
906  ApplyArtificialCollision(offset);
907  break;
908  }

910  // @script | Vehicle_IsSkaterVisible | true if skater should be visible while driving
911  case CRCC(0x81faac21, "Vehicle_IsSkaterVisible"):
912  return m_skater_visible ? CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE : CBaseComponent::MF_FALSE;
913 
914  default:
915  return CBaseComponent::MF_NOT_EXECUTED;
916  }
917 
918  return CBaseComponent::MF_TRUE;
919 }

1296  // physics model

1300  // bounce damping strength of the suspension; smaller values cause bouncier suspensions; very large values may
1301  // cause instability in the physics model
1302  p_wheel_struct->GetFloat(CRCD(0xafa960ff, "damping_rate"), &wheel.damping);
1303 
1304  // wheel radius (in)
1305  // larger radius wheels are harder for the engine to rotate and the brake and rolling resistance to stop
1306  p_wheel_struct->GetFloat(CRCD(0xc48391a5, "radius"), &wheel.radius);

1311  wheel.inv_moment = vVP_GRAVITATIONAL_ACCELERATION / wheel.inv_moment;
1312  }
1313 
1314  p_wheel_struct->GetFloat(CRCD(0xd87d0183, "max_draw_y_offset"), &wheel.max_draw_y_offset);
1315 
1316  // the following parameters affect the shape of the tire's friction curve
1317  // the friction curve gives the strength of the frictional force as a function of the tire's slip velocity; our
1318  // simple curve rises linearly from zero at zero slip velocity, reaches static_friction at a slip velocity of
1319  // min_static_velocity, remains at static_friction up to a slip velocity of max_static_velocity, drops linearly
1320  // to dynamic_friction until a slip velocity of min_dynamic_velocity, and then remains constant at dynamic_friction
1321 
1322  // normalized friction strength when the wheel is not skidding
1323  // low values will cause the vehicle to be spin-out and skid easily; high values cause the tires to feel sticky;
1324  // real world values are on the order of 1.3; fun values are much higher
1325  p_wheel_struct->GetFloat(CRCD(0xf36b97c8, "static_friction"), &wheel.static_friction);
1326 
1327  // normalized friction strength when the wheel is skidding
1328  // should be lower than static_friction; values much lower than static_friction cause the vehicle to be unforgiving;
1329  // once you lose grip, it is harder to regain control of the vehicle; values near static_friction cause the vehicle
1330  // to be very forgiving, with skidding causing little loss of handling
1331  p_wheel_struct->GetFloat(CRCD(0x674852f6, "dynamic_friction"), &wheel.dynamic_friction);
1332 
1333  // normalized friction strength when the handbrake is applied
1334  // currently specially tuned in script to force a fishtail when the handbrake and throttle are both applied and spin-outs when only handbrake is applied
1335  p_wheel_struct->GetFloat(CRCD(0x52242919, "handbrake_throttle_friction"), &wheel.handbrake_throttle_friction);
1336  p_wheel_struct->GetFloat(CRCD(0x6d615f67, "handbrake_locked_friction"), &wheel.handbrake_locked_friction);
1337 
1338  // slip speed below which tires undergrip (mph)
1339  // should be around 1 to 2 mph
1340  if (p_wheel_struct->ContainsComponentNamed(CRCD(0x60b2c097, "min_static_grip_velocity")))
1341  {
1342  p_wheel_struct->GetFloat(CRCD(0x60b2c097, "min_static_grip_velocity"), &wheel.min_static_velocity);
1343  wheel.min_static_velocity = MPH_TO_IPS(wheel.min_static_velocity);
1344  }
1345 
1346  // maximum slip speed before tires begin to lose their grip (mph)
1347  // should be larger than min_static_velocity; with a low value the vehicle will skid more readily; a high value
1348  // causes there to be a large range of slip velocties with maximum tire grip
1349  if (p_wheel_struct->ContainsComponentNamed(CRCD(0xbb0d9370, "max_static_grip_velocity")))
1350  {

1352  wheel.max_static_velocity = MPH_TO_IPS(wheel.max_static_velocity);
1353  }
1354 
1355  // minimum slip speed before tires begin skidding (imph)
1356  // should be larger than max_static_velocity; with a low values, tires are very unforgiving and begin to skid as soon
1357  // as they begin to slip; with a larger value, the loss of control and onset of skidding will be more gradual
1358  if (p_wheel_struct->ContainsComponentNamed(CRCD(0xb71803ad, "min_dynamic_grip_velocity")))
1359  {
1360  p_wheel_struct->GetFloat(CRCD(0xb71803ad, "min_dynamic_grip_velocity"), &wheel.min_dynamic_velocity);
1361  wheel.min_dynamic_velocity = MPH_TO_IPS(wheel.min_dynamic_velocity);
1362  }

◆ damp_rotation()

void Obj::CVehicleComponent::damp_rotation ( )
private

См. определение в файле vehiclecomponent.cpp строка 1857

1858 {
1859  // no damping when handbraking on the ground
1860  if (m_controls.handbrake && m_num_wheels_in_contact > 2) return;
1861 
1862  if (!m_controls.throttle && m_controls.steering != 0.0f && m_num_wheels_in_contact > 2) return;
1863 
1864  if (in_artificial_collision()) return;
1865 
1866  // apply quadtratic damping
1867 
1868  // quadratic damping in the air makes jump recovery much easier; the vehicle lands on its wheels much more often
1869  float quad_damping = m_time_step * m_quad_rotvel_damping * m_rotmom.LengthSqr();
1870 
1871  // prevent reversal
1872  if (quad_damping > m_rotmom.Length())
1873  {
1874  m_rotmom.Set(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
1875  }
1876  else
1877  {
1878  Mth::Vector direction = m_rotmom;
1879  direction.Normalize();
1880  m_rotmom -= quad_damping * direction;
1881  }
1882 
1883  // apply constant damping; only applied in the Y direction
1884 
1885  // apply only if we're not steering, we're on the ground, and we're relatively upright
1886  if (m_controls.steering == 0.0f && m_num_wheels_in_contact > 2 && m_orientation_matrix[Y][Y] > 0.5f)
1887  {
1888  float const_damping = m_time_step * m_const_rotvel_damping;;
1889 
1890  // prevent reversal
1891  if (Mth::Abs(const_damping) > Mth::Abs(m_rotmom[Y]))
1892  {
1893  m_rotmom[Y] = 0.0f;
1894  }
1895  else
1896  {
1897  m_rotmom[Y] += (m_rotmom[Y] > 0.0f ? -const_damping : const_damping);
1898  }
1899  }
1900 }

◆ calculate_friction_coefficient()

float Obj::CVehicleComponent::calculate_friction_coefficient ( SWheel &  wheel,
float  velocity 
) const
private

См. определение в файле vehiclecomponent.cpp строка 1505

1506 {
1507  // friction based on section 2.4 and 2.7 of Race Car Vehicle Dynamics by Milliken
1508 
1509  // the tire friction coefficient curve is very simple; just four concatenated lines
1510 
1511  if (m_controls.handbrake)
1512  {
1513  // handbrake friction is a total scam
1514 
1515  float friction;
1516  if (m_controls.throttle)
1517  {
1518  friction = wheel.handbrake_throttle_friction;
1519  wheel.state = SWheel::HANDBRAKE_THROTTLE;
1520  }
1521  else
1522  {
1523  friction = wheel.handbrake_locked_friction;
1524  wheel.state = SWheel::HANDBRAKE_LOCKED;
1525  }
1526 
1527  if (velocity < wheel.min_static_velocity)
1528  {
1529  // under gripped handbrake "skidding"
1530  wheel.state = SWheel::UNDER_GRIPPING;
1531  return friction * velocity / wheel.min_static_velocity;
1532  }
1533  else
1534  {
1535  // handbrake "skidding"
1536  return friction;
1537  }
1538  }
1539 
1540  float multiplier = m_controls.brake ? 2.0f : 1.0f;
1541 
1542  if (velocity < wheel.min_static_velocity)
1543  {
1544  // under gripped
1545  wheel.state = SWheel::UNDER_GRIPPING;
1546  return wheel.static_friction * velocity / wheel.min_static_velocity;
1547  }
1548  else if (velocity < wheel.max_static_velocity)
1549  {
1550  // maximum grip
1551  wheel.state = SWheel::GRIPPING;
1552  return multiplier * wheel.static_friction;
1553  }
1554  else if (velocity < wheel.min_dynamic_velocity)
1555  {
1556  // on the verge of skidding
1557  wheel.state = SWheel::SLIPPING;
1558  return multiplier * wheel.dynamic_friction + (wheel.static_friction - wheel.dynamic_friction)
1559  * (velocity - wheel.max_static_velocity) / (wheel.min_dynamic_velocity - wheel.max_static_velocity);
1560  }
1561  else
1562  {
1563  // skidding
1564  wheel.state = SWheel::SKIDDING;
1565  return multiplier * wheel.dynamic_friction;
1566  }
1567 }

1580

1597  // the calculation below must be repeated

1601

1603  projected_vel -= wheel.rotvel * wheel.radius * wheel_direction;
1604

◆ calculate_body_point_effective_mass()

float Obj::CVehicleComponent::calculate_body_point_effective_mass ( const Mth::Vector &  pos,
const Mth::Vector &  direction 
) const
private

См. определение в файле vehiclecomponent.cpp строка 2910

2911 {
2912  // calculate the effect on momentums due to a unit impulse applied at pos towards direction
2913  Mth::Vector delta_mom = direction;
2914  Mth::Vector delta_rotmom = Mth::CrossProduct(pos, direction);
2915 
2916  // calculate the resulting change in velocities
2917  Mth::Vector delta_vel = m_inv_mass * delta_mom;
2918  Mth::Vector delta_rotvel = m_inv_moment.Rotate(delta_rotmom);
2919 
2920  // calculate the corresponding change in the body point's velocity
2921  Mth::Vector delta_vel_body_point = delta_vel + Mth::CrossProduct(delta_rotvel, pos);
2922 
2923  // extract the change in velocity along the direction of interest
2924  float delta_vel_direction = Mth::DotProduct(direction, delta_vel_body_point);
2925 
2926  // return the effective mass of the body point in the direction of interest
2927  Dbg_Assert(delta_vel_direction != 0.0f);
2928  return 1.0f / delta_vel_direction;
2929 }

1700  // ground. If not, we teleport the wheel to its hang point.
1701

1703

1712  feeler.m_start = wheel.feeler_start_world;
1713  feeler.m_end = wheel.feeler_end_world;

1724  if (reset_this_frame()) return;
1725  trip_trigger(TRIGGER_SKATE_ONTO, feeler);
1726  if (reset_this_frame()) return;
1727  }
1728  }
1729  else
1730  {
1731  trip_trigger(TRIGGER_SKATE_ONTO, feeler);
1732  if (reset_this_frame()) return;
1733  }

1736

1740 
1741  m_num_wheels_in_contact++;
1742

1744  }
1745  else
1746  {
1747  // trip any triggers
1748  if (wheel.state != SWheel::OUT_OF_CONTACT)
1749  {
1750  trip_trigger(TRIGGER_SKATE_OFF, wheel.last_ground_feeler);
1751  if (reset_this_frame()) return;
1752  }
1753 
1754  wheel.state = SWheel::OUT_OF_CONTACT;
1755  wheel.y_offset = wheel.y_offset_hang;

1763  if (feeler.GetCollision(false))
1764  {
1765  trip_trigger(TRIGGER_BONK, feeler);
1766  if (reset_this_frame()) return;
1767  }
1768  }

◆ accumulate_forces()

void Obj::CVehicleComponent::accumulate_forces ( )
private

См. определение в файле vehiclecomponent.cpp строка 1907

1908 {
1909  // forces and torques on the body accumulate and are applied at the end of the frame; torques on the wheels are too large to accumulate;
1910  // they are applied to wheel velocity as they occur; thus, the order of application of wheel torques is critical
1911 
1912  apply_gravitational_forces();
1913 
1914  apply_suspension_forces();
1915 
1916  // we calculate the friction coefficients before applying engine torques so that friction will get the chance to counteract rotational
1917  // accelerations using static friction before the wheels spin out due to engine torque
1918  calculate_friction_coefficients();
1919 
1920  if (!m_controls.handbrake)
1921  {
1922  apply_engine_forces();
1923 
1924  apply_drag_forces();
1925 
1926  // give the brakes a chance to cancel the rotation due to engine torque and to lock up the wheels before friction effects
1927  apply_brake_forces();
1928 
1929  apply_friction_forces();
1930 
1931  // after friction, the brakes are given the opportunity to apply additional torque and relock the wheels
1932  apply_spare_brake_forces();
1933  }
1934  else
1935  {
1936  if (m_controls.throttle)
1937  {
1938  apply_engine_forces();
1939 
1940  // scale the handbrake's braking effect with the steering factor; thus, you power through sharp handbrake turns; yet, the handbrake
1941  // still brakes on straight aways
1942  apply_handbrake_forces(1.0f - Mth::Abs(m_controls.steering));
1943 
1944  apply_friction_forces();
1945 
1946  apply_spare_brake_forces();
1947  }
1948  else
1949  {
1950  apply_friction_forces();
1951 
1952  // lock wheels
1953  for (int n = m_num_wheels; n--; )
1954  {
1955  mp_wheels[n].rotvel = 0.0f;
1956  mp_wheels[n].rotacc = 0.0f;
1957  }
1958  }
1959  }
1960 }

Перекрестные ссылки Mth::Abs(), apply_brake_forces(), apply_drag_forces(), apply_engine_forces(), apply_friction_forces(), apply_gravitational_forces(), apply_handbrake_forces(), apply_spare_brake_forces(), apply_suspension_forces(), calculate_friction_coefficients(), Obj::CVehicleComponent::SControls::handbrake, m_controls, m_num_wheels, mp_wheels, Obj::CVehicleComponent::SWheel::rotacc, Obj::CVehicleComponent::SWheel::rotvel, Obj::CVehicleComponent::SControls::steering и Obj::CVehicleComponent::SControls::throttle.

◆ apply_friction_forces()

void Obj::CVehicleComponent::apply_friction_forces ( )
private

См. определение в файле vehiclecomponent.cpp строка 2048

2049 {
2050  // NOTE: we've handled longitudinal friction reversal successfully; however, tangential friction reversal is still a significant issue for large
2051  // friction coefficients and high centers of mass
2052 
2053  // we use a simple tire model were the friction force is opposite the velocity of the tire contact and proportional to the normal force and a
2054  // friction coefficient; the friction coefficient is a function of the velocity of the contact with the following form:
2055  // 0 < v < min_static_velocity: rises linearly from zero to static_friction
2056  // min_static_velocity < v < max_static_velocity: constant at static_friction
2057  // max_static_velocity < v < min_dynamic_velocity: falls linearly from static_friction to dynamic_friction
2058  // min_dynamic_velocity < v: constant at dynamic_friction
2059 
2060  // NOTE: because friction is zero at zero slip velocity, hill slippage is an issue
2061 
2062  for (int n = m_num_wheels; n--; )
2063  {
2064  SWheel& wheel = mp_wheels[n];
2065 
2066  if (wheel.state == SWheel::OUT_OF_CONTACT) continue;
2067 
2068  // grab the cached wheel direction and velocity projected into the contact plane
2069  Mth::Vector projected_wheel_direction = wheel.cache_projected_direction;
2070  Mth::Vector projected_vel = wheel.cache_projected_vel;
2071 
2072  // subtract the contact patch velocity; positive wheel rotational velocity equals negative contact patch velocity
2073  projected_vel -= wheel.rotvel * wheel.radius * projected_wheel_direction;
2074 
2075  // store the slip vel for later display
2076  wheel.slip_vel = projected_vel.Length();
2077 
2078  // if the velocity is too small, its direction is meaningless
2079  if (wheel.slip_vel < 0.000001) continue;
2080 
2081  // propose a frictional force
2082  Mth::Vector vel_direction = projected_vel;
2083  vel_direction.Normalize();
2084  Mth::Vector proposed_force = -wheel.friction_coefficient * wheel.normal_force * vel_direction;
2085 
2086  // now we must check that this force is not more that the force which would stop the relative longitudinal velocity
2087 
2088  // calculate the torque required to stick the wheel contact patch to the ground
2089  float longitudinal_vel = Mth::DotProduct(projected_vel, projected_wheel_direction);
2090  float stopping_rotvel = longitudinal_vel / wheel.radius;
2091  float stopping_torque = -calculate_stopping_torque(wheel, stopping_rotvel);
2092 
2093  // calculate the proposed torque
2094  float proposed_torque = -wheel.radius * Mth::DotProduct(proposed_force, projected_wheel_direction);
2095 
2096  Mth::Vector force;
2097  float torque;
2098 
2099  // if the proposed torque is less than what is required to stop the rotation
2100  if (Mth::Abs(proposed_torque) < Mth::Abs(stopping_torque))
2101  {
2102  // we're ok
2103  force = proposed_force;
2104  torque = proposed_torque;
2105  }
2106  else
2107  {
2108  // otherwise, reduce the proposed longitudinal force to only the stopping force
2109  float proposed_longitudinal_force = Mth::DotProduct(proposed_force, projected_wheel_direction);
2110  float stopping_longitudinal_force = -stopping_torque / wheel.radius;
2111  force = proposed_force + (stopping_longitudinal_force - proposed_longitudinal_force) * projected_wheel_direction;
2112 
2113  torque = stopping_torque;
2114  }
2115 
2116  // apply the force to the body
2117  accumulate_force(force, wheel.pos_world, MAKE_RGB(0, 0, 255));
2118 
2119  // apply the torque to the wheel
2120  apply_wheel_torque(wheel, torque);
2121  }
2122 }

2842

2866  target[Z].Normalize();

2874  target[Y] = Mth::CrossProduct(target[Z], target[X]);
2875  target[W].Set();

2878  Mth::SlerpInterpolator slerper;

2880

2882  if (m_vel[X] * m_vel[X] + m_vel[Z] * m_vel[Z] > 350.0f * 350.0f)
2883  {
2884  slerper.getMatrix(&m_orientation_matrix, Mth::LinearMap(
2885  0.0f,
2886  m_in_air_slerp_strength * m_time_step,
2887  Mth::Min(m_air_time_no_collision, m_in_air_slerp_time_delay),

2898  0.0f,

2900  ));

2633  // calculate the normal impulse required to reach the body velocity
2634  float normal_impulse = (goal_normal_velocity - normal_vel) * effective_mass;
2635 
2636  // accumulate the total normal impulse applied to this collision point
2637  collision.normal_impulse += normal_impulse;
2638 
2639  // setup the required impulse vector
2640  Mth::Vector impulse = normal_impulse * collision.normal;
2641 
2642  // apply the normal impulse immediately
2643  apply_impulse(impulse, pos_local);
2644  }
2645 
2646  if (++pass_count > 5)
2647  {
2648  #ifdef __USER_DAN__
2649  MESSAGE("environment collision resolution pass count limit exceeded");
2650  #endif
2651  break;
2652  }
2653  } while (!clean_pass);
2654 
2655  if (m_draw_debug_lines)
2656  {
2657  for (int collision_idx = m_num_collision_points; collision_idx--; )
2658  {
2659  // SCollisionPoint& collision = sp_collision_points[collision_idx];
2660  // Gfx::AddDebugLine(
2661  // collision.pos + collision.normal,
2662  // collision.pos + collision.normal + collision.normal_impulse / 2.0f * collision.normal,
2663  // MAKE_RGB(0, 100, 100), MAKE_RGB(0, 100, 100), 1
2664  // );
2665  }
2666  } // END loop over collision points
2667 
2668  // apply penalty forces to prevent interpenetration
2669  for (int collision_idx = m_num_collision_points; collision_idx--; )
2670  {
2671  SCollisionPoint& collision = sp_collision_points[collision_idx];
2672 
2673  // collision normal is facing opposite the depth
2674  // BUG: too many rect feeler collisions have negative depth!!!
2675  if (collision.depth <= 0.0f) continue;
2676 
2677  // extremely deep collisions are mostly collisions with the underbody which are actually shallow in the Y direction; for now we'll cap such
2678  // collisions and perhaps allow the car to sink down into geometry which comes from below but misses the wheels
2679  if (collision.depth > 2.0f)
2680  {
2681  collision.depth = 2.0f;
2682  }
2683 
2684  Mth::Vector force = m_body_spring * collision.depth * collision.normal;
2685 
2686  accumulate_collision_force(force, collision.pos - m_pos);
2687 
2688  // Gfx::AddDebugLine(
2689  // collision.pos,
2690  // collision.pos + (2 * collision.depth) * collision.normal,
2691  // MAKE_RGB(255, 255, 0), MAKE_RGB(255, 255, 0), 1
2692  // );
2693  }
2694 
2695  float body_friction = m_orientation_matrix[Y][Y] > 0.707f ? m_body_friction : m_body_wipeout_friction;
2696 
2697  // apply a friction impulse at each point
2698  for (int collision_idx = m_num_collision_points; collision_idx--; )
2699  {
2700  SCollisionPoint& collision = sp_collision_points[collision_idx];
2701 
2702  if (collision.normal_impulse == 0.0f) continue;
2703 
2704  // calculate the local collision position
2705  Mth::Vector pos_local = collision.pos - m_pos;
2706 
2707  // calculate the tangential velocity
2708  Mth::Vector vel = cache_vel + Mth::CrossProduct(cache_rotvel, pos_local);
2709  Mth::Vector tanjent = vel - Mth::DotProduct(vel, collision.normal) * collision.normal;
2710  float tanjent_vel = tanjent.Length();
2711  if (tanjent_vel < 0.001f) continue;
2712  tanjent /= tanjent_vel;
2713 
2714  // calculate the effective mass of the collision point
2715  float effective_mass = calculate_body_point_effective_mass(pos_local, tanjent);
2716 
2717  // calculate the tanjential impulse required to stop the tanjential velocity
2718  float tanjent_impulse = tanjent_vel * effective_mass;
2719 
2720  // cap the frictional force at the normal force times the coefficient of friction
2721  float max_tanjent_impulse = body_friction * collision.normal_impulse;
2722 
2723  if (tanjent_impulse > max_tanjent_impulse)
2724  {
2725  tanjent_impulse = max_tanjent_impulse;
2726  }
2727 
2728  // setup the tanjent impulse vector
2729  Mth::Vector impulse = -tanjent_impulse * tanjent;
2730 
2731  // apply the friction impulse to the true state
2732  apply_impulse(impulse, pos_local);
2733 
2734  if (m_draw_debug_lines)
2735  {
2736  // Gfx::AddDebugLine(
2737  // collision.pos + collision.normal,
2738  // collision.pos + collision.normal + impulse / 2.0f,
2739  // MAKE_RGB(100, 0, 100), MAKE_RGB(100, 0, 100), 1
2740  // );
2741  }
2742 
2743  // apply the friction impulse to the state we are using for friction calculations
2744  cache_mom += impulse;
2745  cache_rotmom += Mth::CrossProduct(pos_local, impulse);
2746  cache_vel = m_inv_mass * cache_mom;
2747  cache_rotvel = m_inv_moment.Rotate(cache_rotmom);
2748  } // END loop over collision points
2749 
2750  // determine the maximum normal impulse this frame
2751  for (int collision_idx = m_num_collision_points; collision_idx--; )
2752  {
2753  SCollisionPoint& collision = sp_collision_points[collision_idx];
2754 
2755  m_max_normal_collision_impulse = Mth::Max(collision.normal_impulse, m_max_normal_collision_impulse);
2756  }
2757 
2758  // no player controlled impulses in the air or with handbrake on
2759  if (m_controls.steering == 0.0f || m_num_wheels_in_contact < 3 || m_controls.handbrake) return;
2760 
2761  // extra player controled collision impulse; allows one slight control over the direction on collision impulses
2762  for (int collision_idx = m_num_collision_points; collision_idx--; )
2763  {
2764  SCollisionPoint& collision = sp_collision_points[collision_idx];
2765 
2766  Mth::Vector pos_local = collision.pos - m_pos;
2767 
2768  float strength = m_controls.steering * m_collision_control * Mth::DotProduct(m_orientation_matrix[Z], collision.normal) * collision.normal_impulse;
2769 
2770  Mth::Vector direction(-collision.normal[Z], 0.0f, collision.normal[X]);
2771 
2772  apply_impulse(strength * direction, pos_local);
2773 
2774  if (m_draw_debug_lines)
2775  {
2776  Gfx::AddDebugLine(
2777  collision.pos + collision.normal,
2778  collision.pos + collision.normal + strength * direction / 5.0f,
2779  MAKE_RGB(255, 0, 100), MAKE_RGB(255, 0, 100), 1
2780  );
2781  }
2782  }
2783 }

Перекрестные ссылки accumulate_collision_force(), Gfx::AddDebugLine(), apply_impulse(), calculate_body_point_effective_mass(), calculate_body_point_velocity(), calculate_collision_depth(), check_for_capping(), consider_culling_point(), Mth::CrossProduct(), CFeeler::DebugLine(), CRectFeeler::DebugLines(), Obj::CVehicleComponent::SCollisionPoint::depth, Mth::DotProduct(), NsBuffer::end(), Nx::S2DCollSurface::ends, CFeeler::GetCollision(), CRectFeeler::GetCollision(), CRectFeeler::GetMergedCollisionSurface(), CFeeler::GetNormal(), CRectFeeler::GetNumMergedCollisionSurfaces(), CFeeler::GetPoint(), Obj::CVehicleComponent::SControls::handbrake, Mth::Vector::Length(), Obj::CVehicleComponent::SCollisionPoint::line, m_body_friction, m_body_restitution, m_body_spring, m_body_wipeout_friction, m_collision_cache, m_collision_control, m_controls, Mth::Rectangle::m_corner, m_draw_debug_lines, Mth::Line::m_end, Mth::Rectangle::m_first_edge, m_inv_mass, m_inv_moment, m_max_normal_collision_impulse, m_mom, m_num_collision_points, m_num_wheels_in_contact, m_orientation_matrix, m_pos, m_rotmom, m_rotvel, Mth::Rectangle::m_second_edge, Mth::Line::m_start, m_vel, Mth::Max(), CRectFeeler::MergeCollisionSurfaces(), mp_colliders, Nx::S2DCollSurface::normal, Obj::CVehicleComponent::SCollisionPoint::normal, Obj::CVehicleComponent::SCollisionPoint::normal_impulse, Nx::S2DCollSurface::S2DCollEndpoint::point, Obj::CVehicleComponent::SCollisionPoint::pos, reset_this_frame(), Mth::Matrix::Rotate(), CRectFeeler::SetCache(), CFeeler::SetCache(), CRectFeeler::SetRectangle(), sp_collision_points, Obj::CVehicleComponent::SControls::steering, Nx::S2DCollSurface::S2DCollEndpoint::tangent_exists, Obj::TRIGGER_BONK, trip_trigger(), Obj::CVehicleComponent::SCollider::world, X, Y и Z.

2792  // The vehicle has two uber frigs. The first treats the c.o.m. as a point particle with respect to the geo. The seconds is a traditional uber frig.
2793 
2794  Mth::Vector frame_start_pos = m_pos;
2795
